intro: Lithospermum fimbriopetalum, commonly known as the fringed-petaled rock pepper, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern China. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, violet to purple flowers with distinctive fringed petals, typically blooming in late summer. Its root system is known to contain bioactive compounds, making it of interest in traditional medicine. Lithospermum fimbriopetalum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone habitats.
